job_info: The Associate Stop Loss Underwriter is responsible for performing general underwriting tasks for both new and renewal business, as well as analyzing and evaluating client healthcare data for usability, ensuring its successful mapping through our pipeline, and understanding its representation on our platforms. This is an on-site position (not remote) located in Onalaska, WI.  The Insurance Center is a successful and well-established independent insurance agency seeking a dependable and hardworking individual to join our team. The Insurance Center is committed to providing a diverse and challenging work environment encouraging critical thinking, problem solving and project management.  Responsibilities and Duties  Key Responsibilities include:  Engage with various analytics platforms to extract, analyze, validate, and present data.  Ensure the quality and accuracy of healthcare claims and eligibility data.  Maintain data quality software tools to analyze data, detect errors and report anomalies.  Interpret data to ensure accurate data deliver to consultants and clients.  Engage with consultants and clients to answer questions and deliver data in a manner that is understandable.  Analyze risk factors for new business and annual renewals in conformance with established underwriting standards, policies, and practices.  Prepare a variety of reports and provide rationale and support to the Corporate Benefits consultant team.  Calculate budget rates and evaluate a variety of contractual stop loss provisions.  Analyze individual member risk.  Use predictive modeling to estimate annual expected claims.  Qualifications and Skills  Minimum of an associate degree in data science/analytics, actuarial science, accounting, finance, or business and two to three years of related experience and/or training in an underwriting role; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Tech savvy with data visualization experience. Above average proficiency and knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook, internet navigation and a variety of database platforms required. IT-related experience preferred with strong problem-solving skills. Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills. High level of curiosity with ability to conduct and present self-directed research. Strong ability to analyze and visualize data. Employee benefits knowledge and self-funding a plus.  The Insurance Center is proud to be a Great Place to Work® certified company!  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, T.I.C., Inc. will recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Our Practices and Procedures, including those relating to wages, benefits, transfers, promotions, terminations, and self-development opportunities, will be administered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status and all other classes protected by the Federal and State Government.  Benefits  The Insurance Center offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits package including 401(k) plan, medical, dental, vision, life insurance and more. Consistent with our healthy work life balance we offer paid holidays and a generous paid time off policy.  For immediate consideration, qualified applicants should submit a letter of application, resume, and salary requirements to jobs@ticinsurance.com.  Job Type: Full-time  Benefits:  401(k)  Dental insurance  Employee assistance program  Flexible spending account  Health insurance  Health savings account  Life insurance  Paid time off  Vision insurance  Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Work Location: In person

Job Description  DEPARTMENT  : Analytics  JOB     TITLE  : Manager of Data Science  REPORTS     TO  : Director of Analytics  WHO WE ARE:   Nuvative is a fast-growing innovative technology company impacting employees through continuing education and guidance. As an employer of choice, we provide our employees with a culture of kindness, fairness, self-development, contribution, collaboration, diversity, innovation, and fun.  JOB     PURPOSE:     The Manager of Data Science at Nuvative, Inc., will play a key role in shaping our underwriting strategy, guiding the development of predictive models, and delivering actionable insights to support business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of managing a team of data scientists, developing advanced analytical models, and driving data-driven decision-making processes with a strong background in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning, with a passion for leveraging data to drive business decisions. The Manager of Data Science also works closely with the Data Science team on analysis and prediction of trends while supporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day delivery of projects and initiatives.  ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE, DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES  Manager of Data Science  RESPONSIBILITIES  Manage a team of data scientists to develop and implement analytical models and algorithms.  Lead the design and execution of data science projects to support business goals.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables.  Provide strategic guidance on data science initiatives and best practices.  Communicate complex technical concepts and findings to non-technical stakeholders.  Stay current with the latest developments in data science and apply best practices to solve business challenges.  Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.  Identify gaps in current data systems, drive and contribute to development of systems to bridge gap.  Plans and executes ongoing strategies including maximization of technologies and processes.  Responding with urgency to high priority requests from senior business leaders.  Take initiative to make things better and provide solutions for challenges.  Anticipate operational needs based on volume/expansion and make recommendations.  Drive change – produce clear, understandable visualizations and reports to share with Senior Management.  Any other duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS  BS, MS or PhD in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field (with a minimum of 3 years of experience preferred).  In depth knowledge and understanding of finance and loan underwriting desired.  5+ years of experience in data science, with at least 2 years in a management or leadership role.  Strong SQL abilities and experience with massive relational database systems.  Programming skills in R or Python and experience with related machine learning packages.  Proven track record of assisting business decisions with accurate data and analysis.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Excellent leadership, communication, project management skills, and collaboration abilities.  COMPETENCIES  Ability to produce significant output with minimal waste of effort.  Plans, organizes, and schedules time in an efficient, productive manner.  Ability to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it. Exhibits a probing mind and achieves penetrating insights.  Not allowing crucial details to slip through the cracks or derail a project.  Reaches out to peers and cooperates with supervisors to establish an overall collaborative working relationship.  Ability to communicate well, including the ability to take complex topics and create relatable narratives for different audiences.  A decisive individual with excellent organizational skills and the ability to multi-task effectively  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel in this position.  Job Type: Full-time

ProviderTrust Summary  ProviderTrust was founded in 2010 with a mission to create safer healthcare for everyone through OIG and state Medicaid exclusion monitoring. Today, the organization has developed the industry’s most accurate dataset for ongoing exclusion monitoring and primary source verification, serving the nation’s top health systems, payers, and pharmacy organizations. Our solutions monitor employees, vendors, provider networks, licenses, credentials, and more for OIG and state Medicaid exclusions, sanctions or disciplinary actions, license expirations, or suspensions. With 100+ team members, our Nashville-based company has consistently been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Modern Healthcare, Inc. Magazine, and The Tennessean Top Work Places. To learn more, visit [providertrust.com].  We are looking for a Senior Data Product Manager to oversee our data products and focus on efficiently optimizing for accurate and timely outcomes. This role will seek to understand the needs of external and internal stakeholders, formulate a product strategy, and maintain a roadmap to achieve the company’s goals. The ideal candidate will be able to wield technical and data concepts to achieve product objectives expertly.  Accountabilities  Strategic Oversight  : Develop and implement a data product strategy that aligns with our mission to increase positive data outcomes.  Lifecycle Management  : Lead the product development lifecycle, from ideation to launch, efficiently optimizing for accurate and timely outcomes.  Cross-Functional Collaboration  : Work closely with engineering, product, and business teams to integrate data products into our product offerings, ensuring they meet internal and external needs.  Roadmap Development  : Maintain a dynamic data product roadmap that reflects our commitment to automation and efficiency, balancing technological advancements with client requirements.  Feedback Integration  : Establish a robust feedback loop with all stakeholders to continuously refine our data products, emphasizing the reduction of manual interventions.  Risk Management  : Proactively identify and address risks in our data processing and automation systems, ensuring reliability and accuracy.  Data Literacy Promotion  : Enhance organization-wide data literacy by creating clear documentation and workflows for our data products.  Innovation:   Actively looking for ways to leverage existing and new data sources to enhance and/or create new products and services that the market needs or will find valuable.  Key KPIs  Improvement in Data Product Timeliness and Accuracy  Client Satisfaction with Data Results  Reduction in Manual Data Processing Interventions  Required skills and qualifications  Experience  : At least 4 years in product management, data science, or a related field, with a proven track record of developing and managing data products.  Skills  : Expertise in defining, scoping, and automating complex data processes. Strong background in ER modeling, data structure design, and data flow diagrams. Technical proficiency in SQL and experience with APIs.  Knowledge  : Familiarity with data warehousing, cloud platforms, and modern data stacks.  Industry Insight  : Prior experience in healthcare software or related industries is highly preferred.  Strategic Aptitude  : Ability to think strategically and plan for growth and monetization initiatives.  Collaboration  : Experience working with cross-functional teams in an Agile or Scrum environment. Proficient in software development tools like Jira and Confluence.  What It's Like to Work Here  At ProviderTrust, we recognize that experience is built in a number of ways. If you have relevant skills that are not reflected in your resume or your experience doesn’t match our exact requirements, we welcome your candidacy and encourage you to share more. We champion building a team that embodies empathy, equity, respect, and inclusivity while actively supporting our community, clients, partners, and friends. We value differences of opinion and embrace unique perspectives. We desire an environment that allows all team members to bring their whole selves to work unashamedly. We carefully consider every application and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time. ProviderTrust is an equal opportunity employer.  To be great at ProviderTrust, we find our team members have these things in common:  Gain energy from working in a fast-paced, creative environment  Decision-making that employs a blend of data-driven insights and intuition  Ability to multitask and handle multiple projects concurrently  Resilience and positivity, able to address setbacks and bounce back quickly  Resourcefulness, discovering creative ways to get things done  Joy in making an immediate and positive impact  Diverse interests that are welcomed and extend beyond our organization  Things That Make Us A Great Place To Work  Hybrid schedule: 3 days in office  Competitive base salary and incentive package with 401k matching, HSA employer contribution, and company-paid life and disability insurance  Medical, dental, and vision benefits: PT pays 80% of your premiums. We also offer access to a range of free mental health and well-being resources.  Unlimited PTO, 11 paid holidays, and a flexible work schedule  Internal professional growth, development, and mobility  Daily all-company morning huddles to sync up across the business  In-office experience: fully stocked kitchen, ergonomic desk setup, dog-friendly, and many celebrations!  Remote experience: home office set-up with technology provided, remote-friendly meetings and celebrations, and interest-specific Slack channels for connecting across teams  Fitness stipend, wellness program, and cell phone reimbursement  Modern Healthcare Best Places to Work (2021-2024)  The Tennessean Top Work Places (2022-2024)  Job Type: Full-time  Benefits:  401(k)  401(k) matching  Dental insurance  Employee assistance program  Flexible schedule  Flexible spending account  Health insurance  Health savings account  Life insurance  Paid time off  Parental leave  Professional development assistance  Retirement plan  Vision insurance  Compensation package:  Bonus opportunities  Experience level:  3 years  Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nashville, TN 37203

Cell Therapy Navigators (Oncology Nurse Navigators)  Inizio Engage is looking to build a team of passionate and highly motivated Cell Therapy Navigators, in collaboration with Iovance Biotherapeutics, to drive the education and adoption of a new FDA-approved cell therapy providing new possibilities to patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma.  As a Cell Therapy Navigator you will play a critical role in educating physicians and oncology healthcare providers about a novel cell therapy and how to access that therapy at authorized treatment centers. You will be responsible for building strong relationships with healthcare professionals, delivering in-depth product knowledge, and educating on authorized treatment centers where patients can receive lifesaving therapy.  This is your opportunity to join Inizio Engage and represent a top biopharmaceutical company!  What’s in it for you?  Competitive compensation  Excellent Benefits – accrued time off, medical, dental, vision, 401k, disability & life insurance, paid maternity and bonding time benefits, employee discounts/promotions  Generous performance-driven Incentive Compensation package  Competitive environment with company wide recognition, contests, and coveted awards  Exceptional company culture  Recognized as a Top Workplace USA 2021  Awarded a “Great Place to Work” award in 2022 and 2023  Fortune Best Workplaces in Biopharma 2022  What will you be doing?  The Cell Therapy Navigator will educate high-opportunity, community oncology practices and HCPs on the FDA approved label including indication, clinical data, safety and all key messages to support appropriate patient identification and expedite the patient treatment journey via educating HCPs on Authorized Treatment Centers.  Demonstrate passion and compassion for metastatic or unresectable melanoma.  Demonstrate deep marketplace, therapeutic, product and disease expertise based on thorough understanding of rigorous scientific principles and data, including, indication, efficacy and safety.  Understand and apply knowledge of healthcare industry, trends, applicable laws and regulations, market conditions, and the market access environment (including but not limited to, payer/reimbursement landscape and patient flow/navigation between Authorized Treatment Centers and community practices) and analyze these factors in the development of business plans and in daily execution of interactions with the HCPs within compliance guidelines.  Build and maintain strong professional relationships with physicians/HCPs office staff and others in the patient care continuum.  Foster team effectiveness and accomplishment of shared goals by providing knowledge, experience, and information across cross-functional teams in a compliant and timely way with a strong sense of urgency.  Demonstrate advanced ability to ask strategic, insightful questions to obtain information on customer needs from all stakeholders in accounts, using the insights to position current promoted brands and collaborate with customers on a customized strategy.  What do you need for this position?  2+ years of current or previous nursing experience  Oncology, metastatic melanoma experience and/or cell therapy experience preferred  BSN or equivalent preferred  Previous clinical education, pharmaceutical sales and/or field reimbursement preferred  Current relationships with key high volume community oncology practices within geography/metropolitan area preferred  Experience and proven success in accessing and building relationships with hard to access customers  Demonstrate effective and professional communication with ability to present to various audiences, including physicians and other members of the oncology office staff  Deep understanding of community oncology practices and the challenges they face in relation to navigation of patients to academic treatment centers  Passionate about improving patient outcomes and dedicated to making a difference  Excellent interpersonal skills  Demonstrable organizational skills  Independent self-starter  Willingness to travel with some overnight travel  A valid driver’s license at all times and willingness to notify the company immediately of any endorsement or violations.  About Inizio Engage   Inizio Engage is a strategic, commercial, and creative engagement partner that specializes in healthcare. Our passionate, global workforce augments local expertise and diverse mix of skills with data, science, and technology to deliver bespoke engagement solutions that help clients reimagine how they engage with their patients, payers, people and providers to improve treatment outcomes. Our mission is to partner with our clients, improving lives by helping healthcare professionals and patients get the medicines, knowledge and support they need.  We believe in our values:   We empower everyone/We rise to the challenge/We work as one/We ask what if/We do the right thing,   and we will ask you how your personal values align to them.  To learn more about Inizio Engage, visit us at: https://inizio.health/  Inizio Engage is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Inizio are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Further, pursuant to applicable local ordinances, Inizio will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Inizio Engage is an equal opportunity employer M/F/V/D. We appreciate your interest in our company, however, only qualified candidates will be considered.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: $90,000.00 - $112,500.00 per year  Benefits:  401(k)  401(k) matching  Dental insurance  Disability insurance  Flexible schedule  Health insurance  Life insurance  Paid sick time  Paid time off  Pet insurance  Referral program  Travel reimbursement  Vision insurance  Medical specialties:  Oncology  Supplemental pay types:  Quarterly bonus  Weekly schedule:  Monday to Friday  Education:  Bachelor's (Required)  Experience:  Nursing: 2 years (Required)  Oncology: 2 years (Preferred)  Willingness to travel:  50% (Required)  Work Location: On the road

job_title: Head Of Artificial Intelligence – Americas Region
job_info: We are Covestro. We are curious. We are courageous. We are colorful. We refine chemical material solutions with game-changing products. Let us empower you to push boundaries. Join us and our 18,000 colleagues now and together we will make the world a brighter place.    WHAT WE OFFER    The Head of Artificial Intelligence has the regional responsibility for all processes, procedures, initiatives, and projects in the area of Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Autonomy for Covestro worldwide. This position combines strong leadership capabilities with leading technical expertise in Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Autonomy and will be the driving force to apply them across all Covestro Business Entities, Functions, and sites in the Americas region. This role will lead a regional team of 5-8 employees.    Major Tasks and Responsibilities    Accountable for the implementation of the enterprise-wide AI strategy in the Americas region that aligns with the business goals and objective, in light of the overall Covestro strategy.    Identify opportunities, potentials, and focus areas to leverage AI, technologies across various functions within the Americas region.    Ensure collaboration between cross-functional teams to develop and deploy AI solutions that drive innovation and improve operational efficiency.    Provide guidance on global governance procedures on AI in the Americas region.    Establish partnerships with external vendors, research institutions and associations in the Americas region to enhance Covestro’s perception as a leader in leveraging AI.    Ensure data privacy and security are maintained while implementing AI, /landscape in the Americas region.    Provide leadership to teams of teams of AI professionals and provide mentorship and guidance as needed.    WHAT YOU OFFER    Basic Qualifications    Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, AI or a related discipline with 8 years of relevant experience; OR Master’s degree with 6 years of relevant experience; OR PhD with 5 years of relevant experience    Preferred Qualifications    Master’s degree or PhD is preferred    Experience in leadership roles in an international environment with global/international teams    Knowledge and Skills    Experience in developing and curating use case portfolios in earlier roles and have proven capable of both introducing and scaling Machine Learning /AI technologies in established companies.    Entrepreneurial mindset with ability to work on a variety of different business problems.    Exceptional program management skills.    Collaborative, team player mindset.    Ability to influence and present to colleagues from different fields and different managerial levels.    Willingness and ability to travel internationally.    #LI-JV1    #ind123    #LI-Hybrid    YOUR APPLICATION    Are you as curious, courageous and colorful as we are? If so, we can offer you an exciting career opportunity. We look forward to receiving your application and resume. Become part of our team - apply now!    Equal Employment Opportunity: Hiring and advancement are based on job-related requirements and on an individual's qualifications to perform a job. All aspects of employment are carried out free of discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disabilities, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression or any unlawful criterion, existing under applicable federal, state, or local law.    Contact Us    Info-Hotline: +1 844-522-6775    If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this site as a result of your disability. To make a request, please call (412) 413-2736.

Position Overview:  We are seeking a seasoned and visionary leader to fill the role of   IT Manager  . This key position will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our IT operations and data management initiatives. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in IT systems management, coupled with expertise in data governance, analytics, and strategic planning. The   IT Manager   will play a pivotal role in shaping the organization's technological infrastructure and leveraging data-driven insights to drive innovation and growth.  Key Responsibilities:  1. Strategic Planning and Leadership:  - Develop and execute the strategic vision for IT operations and data management in alignment with organizational goals and objectives.  - Provide leadership and guidance to IT and data teams, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence.  - Collaborate with senior management and stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging technology and data to drive business success.  2. IT Operations Management:  - Oversee the day-to-day operations of the IT department, including infrastructure management, system administration, and technical support services.  - Ensure the reliability, security, and scalability of IT systems and infrastructure to support business operations and growth.  - Develop and implement IT policies, procedures, and best practices to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.  3. Data Governance and Management:  - Establish and enforce data governance policies and procedures to ensure the integrity, security, and privacy of organizational data.  - Lead efforts to define data architecture, standards, and processes to facilitate effective data management and utilization.  - Oversee the collection, storage, and analysis of data to derive actionable insights and drive informed decision-making.  4. Technology Innovation and Optimization:  - Evaluate emerging technologies and trends to identify opportunities for innovation and optimization of IT systems and processes.  - Lead the implementation of new technologies and solutions to improve operational efficiency, enhance user experience, and drive business value.  - Monitor industry developments and benchmarks to ensure that the organization remains at the forefront of technological innovation.  5. Budgeting and Resource Management:  - Develop and manage the IT and data department budget, ensuring that resources are allocated effectively to support strategic initiatives and operational needs.  - Identify opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency improvements while maintaining high standards of service delivery.  - Collaborate within finance and with the procurement teams to negotiate contracts and vendor agreements for IT products and services.  Qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.  - Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT operations management, data governance, or a related field, with at least 3 years in a leadership or management role.  - Strong technical background in IT infrastructure management, system administration, and cybersecurity.  - Demonstrated expertise in data governance, data management, and analytics, with proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques.  - Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.  - Proven track record of successfully leading IT and data initiatives from conception to implementation, with a focus on delivering measurable business outcomes.  - Strategic mindset with the ability to think critically, anticipate future trends, and develop innovative solutions to complex challenges.  Additional Information:  - This is a full-time position based at our Gillette, WY office.  - Occasional travel may be required for meetings, conferences, or other business-related activities.  - We offer competitive salary and benefits packages, including health insurance, retirement plans, and professional development opportunities.  If you are a forward-thinking leader with a passion for technology and data-driven decision-making, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team as the   IT Manager. Job Title: Construction Coordinator  Location:   Onsite - Ellendale, ND  Company Overview:  Applied Digital (APLD) is a leading provider of next-generation digital infrastructure, specializing in High-Performance Computing (HPC) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions. Our mission is to deliver cutting-edge infrastructure to support the most demanding computational needs. We are currently expanding our operations and building a state-of-the-art datacenter in Ellendale, ND. Join our dedicated real estate development team and play a crucial role in this exciting project.  Job Description:  As a Construction Coordinator at Applied Digital, you will be responsible for overseeing the coordination and execution of construction activities for our new datacenter in Ellendale, ND. You will work closely with the APLD real estate development team, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure the project is completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.  Key Responsibilities:  Coordinate and oversee all on-site construction activities, ensuring compliance with project plans, specifications, and schedules.  Collaborate with the real estate development team to plan and execute construction phases, manage timelines, and monitor progress.  Serve as the primary point of contact for contractors, subcontractors, and vendors, facilitating communication and resolving any issues that arise.  Conduct regular site inspections to ensure adherence to safety regulations and quality standards.  Track project milestones and deliverables, providing regular updates to project managers and stakeholders.  Assist in the preparation and review of construction documents, including permits, contracts, and change orders.  Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of project documentation, including daily logs, progress reports, and inspection reports.  Manage procurement and logistics for construction materials and equipment, ensuring timely delivery and proper storage.  Coordinate with local authorities and utility companies to facilitate site access and service connections.  Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to keep the project on track.  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field is preferred. Equivalent experience is considered & respected.  3+ years of experience in construction coordination or project management, preferably in large-scale commercial or industrial projects.  Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and best practices.  Excellent organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.  Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with diverse teams.  Proficiency in construction management software and tools.  Knowledge of safety regulations and compliance requirements.  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience with datacenter construction or other high-tech facilities.  Certification in construction management (e.g., CCM, PMP).  Familiarity with Building Information Modeling (BIM) software.  What We Offer:  Competitive salary and benefits package.  Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.  A dynamic and innovative work environment.  The chance to work on a high-impact, cutting-edge project.  Applied Digital is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation and identity, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or any other factors prohibited by law.  Safety is our top priority. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and healthy work environment for all our employees and contractors. Our construction sites adhere to the highest safety standards and regulations to ensure that everyone goes home safely at the end of the day. We expect all team members to prioritize safety in their daily activities and contribute to our culture of safety excellence.  Join Applied Digital and be part of a team that values safety, innovation, and collaboration. Let's build the future of Datacenters together! Sr. AIOps Engineer  About us  Health Data Analytics Institute (HDAI)   is a care optimization, decision support and provider enablement company powered by big data, AI-driven analytics, expert insights, and point of care technology solutions to facilitate improved patient outcomes and greater efficiency. HDAI collaborates with leading health systems, value-based care organizations, physician groups, and payers to improve care delivery, population health and reduce cost and make efficient use of scarce clinical resources.  Job description  We are looking for an   AIOps/MLOps Engineer   to join our team at HDAI. This team owns our inference pipeline (deployment, CI/CD, monitoring), common tooling to bridge the gap between R&D and production, and an API layer to return inference results. In this role, you will be creating new pipeline components to deliver near real-time inference results, both with in-house models and LLMs, at a national scale. This role comes at a key turning point in our product development: We are transitioning from a legacy application to a Python-based, AWS-native, event driven architecture (you should be familiar with Lambdas, ECS, SQS, and S3, or similar technologies). Maintaining rigorous standards of quality assurance and code development are a core competency of this position – we pride ourselves on delivering model results to clinicians that they can trust. At HDAI, we nurture a culture of continually improving, and one of the best assets of our engineers is a love for learning. We hope that you too share this goal. A successful candidate will demonstrate strong attention to detail, clear communication, and effective follow-through. We are excited to have you as a part of this team!  Job responsibilities  Contribute to the development of our new inference pipeline, model deployment pipeline, and model registry  Participate in the development of a new the API layer between post-process + post-inference data and the frontend application  Participate with test-driven development by writing unit and integration tests for your code  Maintain software using agile best practices, document and fix bugs, update release notes, update documentation, and address backlog items on a regular basis  Contribute to a collaborative work environment with peers across many teams  Qualifications  5+ years of working experience in either a data science role, as a machine learning engineer, or as an MLOps engineer with a background in mathematics or equivalent field of study  Familiarity with developing for cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and Docker  Experience with AWS Lambdas, ECS, SQS, S3, as well as Terraform are a plus  Proficient in implementing event-driven architectures composed of stateless services  Extensive software development experience in Python or similar languages  Applicants must possess a strong ability to diagnose and resolve complex software issues through effective debugging techniques  Familiarity with RESTful APIs  Comfortable working with Git and working on a team using agile/scrum  Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with internal and external teams; ability to develop trust, cooperation, and mutual respect  Preferred education  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent  EO statement  HDAI is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. About the role  Do you have experience in software estimation and process modeling? Are you a creative problem solver who enjoys seeking solutions to complex challenges? Do you want to help the Department of Defense (DoD) solve its toughest software estimation and measurement challenges? We want to meet you!  The Software Measurement and Analysis (SEMA) team is looking for an analytical, customer-focused expert to help customers determine what software-intensive efforts should cost and to work with high-performing researchers and engineers on research and customer projects that advance the state of the art and the state of the practice of software project management.  As a Software Measurement and Estimation Analyst at the SEI, you’ll have the opportunity to work directly with DoD programs, participating on client and research teams that are leading the way in establishing new software estimation and measurement techniques. In this position, you’ll be part of a mission-focused culture of collaboration and transparency, delivering timely, high-quality, high-impact work. You will collaborate with clients and researchers to apply quantitative techniques to assess costs, benefits, and the economic feasibility of alternatives.  What you’ll do  Continuously improve estimation processes and performance modeling technologies.  Identify emerging gaps and limitations in the current models as technology changes.  Develop, improve, and maintain cost estimation models for complex cyber-physical systems and software development projects.  Develop innovative approaches to detect problems early.  Collect, analyze, and evaluate historical benchmark data to provide expert opinion as a basis for assumptions and choice of methodologies.  Collaborate with development, finance, and procurement teams to collect data, align cost estimates with budgetary constraints, and present results.  Apply descriptive statistical methods and facilitate activities such as the Goal-Question-Indicator-Metric (GQIM) process to help stakeholders and customers identify appropriate measurement and displays.  Prepare detailed reports and present findings to senior management.  Who you are  You have experience in software cost estimation and process modeling.  You are familiar with parametric cost estimation and modeling, such as COCOMO, SEER-SEM, PRICE, or QSM-SLIM. You may have a related certification from ICEAA or the Defense Acquisition University.  You have a solid understanding of software development lifecycles and methodologies.  You have financial analysis skills that center on understanding the financial impact of changes to software development costs.  You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  You have strong communication skills, both written and verbal.  You work effectively independently but also enjoy working with a team.  You deliver high-quality work and care about the impact of your work.  You have a bachelor’s degree in statistics, data science, mathematics, or a related quantitative field or discipline with eight (8) years of experience, a master’s degree with five (5) years of experience, or a PhD with two (2) years of experience.  You are able to  Travel to various locations to support the SEI’s overall mission. This includes within the SEI and CMU community, customer sites, and conferences on occasion (up to 25%).  Pass a background check and obtain and maintain an active Department of Defense security clearance.  Legally work for CMU in the United States. CMU will not sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this opportunity.  Who we are  The SEI helps advance software engineering principles and practices and serves as a national resource in software engineering, computer security, and artificial intelligence. The SEI works closely with defense and government organizations, industry, and academia to continually improve software-intensive systems. Our core purpose is to help organizations improve software engineering capabilities and develop or acquire the right software, defect free, within budget and on time, every time.  The Software Engineering Measurement and Analysis team is a group of technical professionals and researchers impacting DoD with data-driven decisions that optimize program execution and radically improve research methodology based on the latest advances in data science, data engineering, applied statistics, causal inference, and decision science. The entire team of Esquire Law Services is dedicated to protecting our clients’ rights and to obtain financial justice from the parties responsible for their losses. We pride ourselves on forging meaningful relationships with our clients, built upon trust, and imparting our principal values into our individualized approach to each case. We are privileged to serve our clients in our community. We maintain a commitment to excellence and justice with an unrelenting devotion and dedication to our core principles. We strive to handle each matter with accountability and responsiveness, as if we were representing ourselves. Job Description:  You’ve always dreamed of working in space, it’s time to make that dream a reality.   We are seeking a preferably experienced Space Communications Analyst to perform modeling and simulation of space communications operations for future missions from near Earth orbit to the surface of the Moon. As a member of our team supporting our NASA tasks, the successful candidate will be provided with training and have the responsibilities below. Due to our work with U.S. government agencies, you must either be a U.S. Citizen, permanent resident, or a Green Card holder.  Responsibilities:  Design space mission simulation scenarios  Develop and integrate satellite platform models  Perform detailed communication analyses using advanced software tools to support planning for future NASA missions and networks  Perform research on existing and in-development mission platforms and communication technologies  Perform research and analysis for lunar surface communication 5G technologies  Prepare professional reports in Word and PowerPoint detailing work performed and its results  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering physics, electrical/computer engineering, or related fields  Dedication to ongoing learning and training  Understanding of RF communication theories and fundamentals  Knowledge and experience with modeling and simulation tools/software  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative team environment  Preferred Skills and Experience:  Demonstrated experience with end-to-end communication system analysis and/or design  Background in space systems and/or satellite communication  Ability to understand and analyze satellite network data and message flows  Familiarity with ground station/network equipment and protocols in satellite communications (RF modulation techniques, error coding, and standards)  Experience working in a collaborative team environment developing technical baseline/systems specification, verification or analysis using engineering applications and simulation models  About the Company:  Located in Rocky River, Comsat Architects was established in 2014 to enhance communications connectivity between Earth and space for near-Earth and lunar missions by providing innovative solutions in software development, data analytics, and space communications design and analysis. We take pride in our dedicated team of employees who specialize in space communications engineering, advanced software, data science, aerospace engineering, systems engineering, and artificial intelligence/machine learning.  We place high value on finding and retaining loyal, intelligent, dedicated, and passionate employees, which allows us to provide superb quality service to all of our clients. We offer a relaxed, open, and collaborative work environment with flexible hours and mentorship opportunities. Through our work, we provide ongoing training and skill improvement and take time to celebrate a job well done. We offer a relaxed, open, and collaborative work environment, with flexible hours and competitive pay. Our benefit package includes PTO, Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA), Tuition Reimbursement, and Simple IRA with matching option. DFT’s engineering team is a diverse and skilled group, determined to develop advanced technical solutions. DFT offers a unique chance to develop and work with modern technologies while delivering impact and seeing products grow from concept to reality. DFT is a results driven culture focused on innovation, creativity, and growth. If you have a passion for solving complex problems, making an immediate impact on a dynamic, and fast moving, product development team, we’d love to hear from you!  What We Need:  DFT is looking for a   Machine Learning Engineer   to join the DFT team to support the company for its product development efforts. The ideal candidate will be energized by a fast-paced work environment, excited by integrating into complex systems, and motivated by having an immediate impact in a challenging environment.  What You’ll Do:  We are specifically looking for people with a background in science and 5-8+ years of experience in taking ML techniques described in literature or in open source and applying those techniques to build custom ML solutions.  Work collaboratively to refine, expand and develop algorithms on real world data.  Building datasets for training ML algorithms.  Support integration of industry leading sensors, algorithms, and capabilities.  Performing data analysis in a Linux environment.  Training ML algorithms using TensorFlow or PyTorch on real-world data.  Act as a technical SME for product data analysis and development.  Optimizing ML models and algorithms for real-time performance on embedded platforms.  Work toward improvement of overall system capabilities and version control library.  Required Skills/Qualifications:  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.  5-8+ years’ experience in ML Engineering role.  Strong Python experience.  Developing custom signal / image processing schemes to process sensor data.  Familiarity with developing and navigating in Linux based environments.  Comfortable with Agile software methodology and development tools specifically Git and Jira.  Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. security clearance.  Preferred Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in STEM discipline (Science, Technical, Engineering, Mathematics)  Experience with acoustic data processing highly desirable  What We Offer:  DFT offers a comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, 401K w/ company match, life insurance, short term disability, 3 weeks PTO, 13 company holidays, and much more. In addition, DFT provides a company culture that encourages:  Collaboration  Innovation  Engagement  Motivation  Salary Range – $140,000- $170,000  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations.  If you are looking for a dynamic place to work where your contribution makes a difference in supporting the mission, DFT is the right company for you. About Us  Cherish develops intelligent radar-based sensor platforms that revolutionize health  and safety monitoring wherever people live, work, or play.. Our patented spatial  computing technology works ambiently (through the air) without changing how  people live and by prioritizing their privacy. We detect emergencies and health and  safety risks to bring people timely help so they and their loved ones may live better  with more independence, safety, and peace of mind.  We are an experienced and close-knit team of visionaries, business leaders,  designers, technologists, creatives, operators, and health and wellness  professionals. We are driven by how we care about the people we serve — our loved  ones and yours. We show up with urgency daily to create and deliver solutions that  will change people’s lives at scale in deeply meaningful ways.  We think and act like a high-energy startup. At the same time, we punch well above  our weight. Our sponsors and engineering, manufacturing, and channel partners  include multiple Fortune 30 companies and globally leading consumer tech and  healthcare organizations with whom we are strongly aligned to move at speed and  scale.  Basics  Founded: 2020  Team: 50+ people, including contractors  Locations: Headquartered in a beautiful Boston location with a thriving in-office  culture.  Why Work Here?  “We're high performers and lifelong learners who enjoy working together, operate  with respect and autonomy, and are on a giant mission that matters at a company on  a path to an IPO. What more could we ask for?”  Senior DSP Engineer  We are seeking an experienced, hands-on Principal Engineer with a strong  background in Digital Signal Processing applied to complex spatial computing,  image and video processing, and visualization applications. In this “team of leaders”  role, you will be an individual contributor and work on the design, development, and  implementation of signal processing algorithms for our radar-based health and  safety platforms. This role requires a strong background in signal processing theory  and real-time implementation on embedded platforms. You will also work in a  collaborative team environment to help envision, architect, and prioritize our  platform’s signal processing features.  While not mandatory, our ideal candidate would also bring meaningful Machine  Learning experience, ideally in similar image, video, and/or radar data processing  applications.  Your Superpowers  You describe yourself as having exceptional technical mastery and innovative  thinking. You pride yourself on excellence in designing complex DSP algorithms and  understanding signal processing systems. Your out-of-the-box thinking enables  groundbreaking solutions, and you collaborate effectively with cross-functional  teams. Your attention to detail ensures thorough, high-standard work. Additionally,  your leadership, mentorship, and enthusiasm inspire your colleagues, promoting  continuous learning and growth across the team  The Job’s Responsibilities  As a collaborative subject-matter expert (SME) on a Team of SMEs, you will use  your superpowers (listed above) to collaborate with others with their superpowers  (you’ll work with others who excel at business strategy, product management, user  experience and industrial design, electronics design and engineering, software  architecture and development, supply chain and logistics management, finance and  business modeling, SCRUM and program management, business development and  contracting, sales, and marketing) in a supportive and safe team setting to achieve  company goals.  You will be responsible for:  ● Design, develop, and optimize DSP algorithms for embedded hardware  platforms using high-level and assembly languages to ensure real-time  performance and resource efficiency.  ● Analyze and interpret signal data to improve detection, tracking, and  classification performance.  ● Collaborate with systems engineers, hardware engineers, and software  developers to ensure seamless integration of DSP components.  ● Work closely with hardware engineers to optimize algorithms for specific  hardware architectures and assist in system integration.  ● Conduct performance evaluations and simulations to validate algorithm  performance and identify areas for improvement.  ● Craft publication-quality data visualizations highlighting results and  improvements  ● Perform system-level integration and testing of signal processing  components.  ● Conduct performance analysis and troubleshooting to identify and resolve  issues.  ● Clearly communicate technical concepts and progress not only within your  team but also to other teams across the company. Ensure that all  departments understand the work that you are doing and how it aligns with  and supports the broader company goals.  ● Develop and maintain documentation for design specifications, test plans, and  user manuals.  ● Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in DSP methodologies and  technologies.  ● Hire, train, and develop team members to foster a culture of innovation and  excellence.  Key Technical Requirements  To hit the ground running, you are comfortable across the entire engineering life  cycle from system design to algorithm development to system testing and  optimization, leading to a successful product launch. In particular:  ● In-depth knowledge of signal processing techniques, including filtering,  modulation, demodulation, spectral analysis, Fourier transforms, and  statistical signal processing.  ● Familiarity with radar tracking methodologies, such as alpha-beta filters,  Kalman filters, or multi-hypothesis trackers (MHT)  ● Proficiency in implementing signal processing algorithms using programming  languages such as Python, MATLAB, or C/C++.  ● Fluency on data science tools like NumPy/Scikit-learn, and cloud services  (Google Cloud Platform).  ● Solid understanding of software development methodologies and version  control systems.  ● Experience with real-time signal processing, DSP platforms, or embedded  systems.  ● Experience with real-time fixed-point signal processing on embedded  systems, including DSP processors and FPGAs.  ● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on system-level  performance optimization.  ● Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment.  In addition, while not essential, it is a definite plus if:  ● You have knowledge of RF engineering principles and practices.  ● You have designed, developed, and optimized advanced DSP algorithms for  signal processing applications, focusing on radar signal processing and  background subtraction.  ● You have expertise in radar signal processing and object detection from RF  signals, including algorithms such as CFAR, SVD, and other radar signal  processing techniques.  ● You have experience analyzing and preprocessing radar data to enhance  signal quality, reduce noise, and extract relevant features.  ● You have machine learning experience, particularly in applying ML techniques  to radar signal processing tasks.  ● You have experience with one or more of the following: radar-to-image  projection, image segmentation, video object detection, or target detection in  radar signal  ● You have experience implementing and optimizing data augmentation  techniques (e.g., image flipping, rotation, scaling, text synonym replacement,  SMOTE) to enhance model performance and robustness  Personal Qualities  We’d love you to be self-aware, thoughtful, empathetic, diligent, hard-working, a  lifelong learner, and a great team player. You’d show us that you have:  ● Strong interpersonal skills and the ability, perhaps even a passion, to build  camaraderie and work effectively on difficult goals with a broad range of  business and technical collaborators across cultures and skills.  ● Self-awareness to know your own superpower (nobody is great at all things)  and the humility to permit others to exercise theirs on a team of accomplished  specialists  ● Respect and empathy to recognize and support the goals of the company,  your team, and colleagues in ways that build trust for people to feel safe to  “disagree and commit” (The Amazon Way)  ● A work ethic that doesn’t quit, that recognizes that time-to-market is often the  only thing that separates teams that win from those that don’t (“No matter how  hard you work, someone else is working harder.” — Elon Musk)  ● Tenacity and a dogged determination to never give up  ● Innate hunger to constantly do better and evolve both your work product and  yourself (You’re a lifelong learner)  ● The courage to move fast, break things, and ship products that people use  (“Real artists ship.” — Steve Jobs)  ● Exceptional communication skills characterized by meticulous attention to  detail and precision in verbal and written expression. Consistently deliver  clear, comprehensive, and precise information to ensure all team members  are aligned and well-informed. Additionally, articulate the team's efforts and  impact on other teams, cultivating close collaboration to achieve  company-wide objectives.  Education and Experience  ● A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Electrical Engineering,  Computer Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.  ● 8+ years of relevant experience in data science.  ● Real-world work experience in relevant roles in a commercial setting.  ● Ideally, full life cycle experience with an electronics product that has shipped  and achieved meaningful commercial success.  ● Preference for candidates with experience in a startup or fast-paced  environment and exposure to ambient sensing and sensor fusion  technologies.  Cherish is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed  to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Cell Therapy Navigators (Clinical Educator)  Inizio Engage is looking to build a team of passionate and highly motivated Cell Therapy Navigators, in collaboration with Iovance Biotherapeutics, to drive the education and adoption of a new FDA-approved cell therapy providing new possibilities to patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma.  As a Cell Therapy Navigator you will play a critical role in educating physicians and oncology healthcare providers about a novel cell therapy and how to access that therapy at authorized treatment centers. You will be responsible for building strong relationships with healthcare professionals, delivering in-depth product knowledge, and educating on authorized treatment centers where patients can receive lifesaving therapy.  This is your opportunity to join Inizio Engage and represent a top biopharmaceutical company!  What’s in it for you?  Competitive compensation  Excellent Benefits – accrued time off, medical, dental, vision, 401k, disability & life insurance, paid maternity and bonding time benefits, employee discounts/promotions  Generous performance-driven Incentive Compensation package  Competitive environment with company wide recognition, contests, and coveted awards  Exceptional company culture  Recognized as a Top Workplace USA 2021  Awarded a “Great Place to Work” award in 2022 and 2023  Fortune Best Workplaces in Biopharma 2022  What will you be doing?  The Cell Therapy Navigator will educate high-opportunity, community oncology practices and HCPs on the FDA approved label including indication, clinical data, safety and all key messages to support appropriate patient identification and expedite the patient treatment journey via educating HCPs on Authorized Treatment Centers.  Demonstrate passion and compassion for metastatic or unresectable melanoma.  Demonstrate deep marketplace, therapeutic, product and disease expertise based on thorough understanding of rigorous scientific principles and data, including, indication, efficacy and safety.  Understand and apply knowledge of healthcare industry, trends, applicable laws and regulations, market conditions, and the market access environment (including but not limited to, payer/reimbursement landscape and patient flow/navigation between Authorized Treatment Centers and community practices) and analyze these factors in the development of business plans and in daily execution of interactions with the HCPs within compliance guidelines.  Build and maintain strong professional relationships with physicians/HCPs office staff and others in the patient care continuum.  Foster team effectiveness and accomplishment of shared goals by providing knowledge, experience, and information across cross-functional teams in a compliant and timely way with a strong sense of urgency.  Demonstrate advanced ability to ask strategic, insightful questions to obtain information on customer needs from all stakeholders in accounts, using the insights to position current promoted brands and collaborate with customers on a customized strategy.  What do you need for this position?  2+ years of current or previous nursing experience  Oncology, metastatic melanoma experience and/or cell therapy experience preferred  BSN or equivalent preferred  Previous clinical education, pharmaceutical sales and/or field reimbursement preferred  Current relationships with key high volume community oncology practices within geography/metropolitan area preferred  Experience and proven success in accessing and building relationships with hard to access customers  Demonstrate effective and professional communication with ability to present to various audiences, including physicians and other members of the oncology office staff  Deep understanding of community oncology practices and the challenges they face in relation to navigation of patients to academic treatment centers  Passionate about improving patient outcomes and dedicated to making a difference  Excellent interpersonal skills  Demonstrable organizational skills  Independent self-starter  Willingness to travel with some overnight travel  A valid driver’s license at all times and willingness to notify the company immediately of any endorsement or violations.  About Inizio Engage   Inizio Engage is a strategic, commercial, and creative engagement partner that specializes in healthcare. We believe in our values:   We empower everyone/We rise to the challenge/We work as one/We ask what if/We do the right thing,   and we will ask you how your personal values align to them. Sitewise Analytics is a recognized, boutique, customer-centric company that has been on the North American commercial real estate scene providing predictive analytics software and solutions since 2012. Industry-leading corporations and franchisors partner with Sitewise Analytics to work out varied business questions from sales forecasting and sales impact assessment, to portfolio optimization and whitespace analysis. Clients include Burger King, Wingstop, Lululemon, The North Face, Aspen Dental, Banfield Pet Hospitals and many other organizations in the restaurant, retail and healthcare sectors.  This role will be based at Sitewise Analytics’ office in Plano, TX, along with other members of the Predictive Analytics Team. The Team uses a hybrid model of working from home and at the office. The company’s owners intentionally facilitate an extraordinary environment that engages employees to stretch, grow and deliver outstanding business support services to customers. At the heart of Sitewise Analytics is a nimble, diverse, motivated and passionate Predictive Analytics Team. The members of the team interact directly with decision-makers at several levels within client companies. Using a dynamic mix of machine learning approaches blended with classical statistical techniques and spatial analytics, the members of the team develop predictive models and provide strategic advice to decision-makers in customer organizations. As a result of successful growth, the Sitewise Analytics Team is delightfully expanding to include another Senior Predictive Modeler.  Using our proprietary modeling processes and Sitewise Pro technology platform, the Senior Predictive Modeler has a mandate to help customers solve complex business challenges. Fundamental to the role is the responsibility to be proactive and curious, to listen deeply to stated and unstated client needs and to develop and implement custom models to address those needs in thoughtful, impactful and explainable ways. The Senior Predictive Modeler will report to the Director of Analytics Operations and work closely with leaders and executives within customer organizations.  The ideal candidate for the role of Senior Predictive Modeler is a calm, creative model builder with superb listening, analytical, organizational, Excel, computer and problem-solving skills. The candidate must have a minimum of three years of relevant business experience, with a proven track record of building statistically sound and interpretable sales forecasting models. The candidate must possess the ability to successfully manage multiple projects, on time, and to work effectively with detail, without losing sight of the big picture. The candidate must a have genuine desire and proven capacity to work directly with clients and a deep commitment to ensuring that services are delivered consistently and in accordance with Sitewise’s internal best practice standards. The candidate must have completed a master-level degree in a relevant discipline such as data science or econometrics. Able to work independently and with minimal supervision, the candidate must be a results-oriented team player who can contribute positively in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities.  Preferred qualifications include experience in machine learning algorithms, including KNN, Random Forest, K-Means Clustering, as well as working knowledge of Alteryx, Python/R. It would be an asset to have experience or prior exposure to market research and retail analytics.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: From $90,000.00 per year  Benefits:  Flexible schedule  Health insurance  Paid time off  Schedule:  8 hour shift  Monday to Friday  No weekends  Supplemental Pay:  Bonus pay  Ability to commute/relocate:  Dallas, TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)  Experience:  analytics: 3 years (Required)  Work Location: In person

job_title: Data Manager (Netsuite Erp) & Website Content Manager
job_info: Scope of Responsibility   – Capitol Scientific, a national distributor of lab supplies and specialty chemicals, seeks to hire a dynamic Data / Content Manager to join our team at our corporate headquarters in Austin, TX. We are experiencing explosive growth and are looking for a Data / Content manager with extensive NetSuite experience to be data-driven, detail oriented and analytical. We also need an excellent communicator who can explain data findings clearly and concisely.  Not many of our team members wear just one hat, so candidates must be comfortable talking to customers, vendors and sales reps to learn about the market and customer needs.  This candidate will become the company’s NetSuite ERP Administrator and also lead the company’s data and pricing management and analysis initiatives. Additionally, the candidate will develop and manage the content management SOPs for the company’s robust e-commerce business. The position requires hands-on data extraction, analysis, project management, verbal and written vendor interaction, in addition to supervisory and staff development skills.  Job Responsibilities   include   three key areas:  I. Data Reporting Management  · Create and provide reports to help improve company sales, profitability and operations.  · A solid understanding of database hierarchy including parent child relationships.  · Standard and custom records creation.  · Know how to research and pull requested data accurately and in a timely fashion.  · Troubleshoot invalid or erred report results from within the scheduled system reports.  · Export searches to use as templates for CSV imports to correct data along with V-Lookups.  · Provide weekly reporting of KPIs.  · Provide internal and ongoing system/technical support and training to ERP users.  II. Website Product Catalog Management  · Design and manage inventory item creation process.  · Ensure accuracy and adherence of and to regulatory data in content descriptions, documentation, and technical literature.  · Manage the acquisition and maintenance of all item data including new item copy / bullets.  · Receive and execute product change orders from company’s manufacturer partners.  · Manage the categorization of all new inventory items while creating new categories as needed.  · Consolidating duplicate categories and maintaining all existing SEO for items and categories  · Work with internal and external stakeholders to obtain product information including descriptions, high resolution images, technical datasheets, product carousels, videos, and other website links.  · Create web descriptions for new product announcements, promotions and clearance events.  · Add KPIs for new item creation process to ensure all requirements are met.  · Provide weekly reporting of KPIs.  · Provide internal and ongoing system/technical support and training to ERP users.  III. Pricing Management  · Follow a documented SOP to contact vendor representatives to obtain and maintain current system-wide product listings and pricing.  · Maintain and comply with company’s pricing policy while working toward a new and improved pricing SOP.  · Manage all product pricing using a custom pricing database built within the ERP system.  · Monitor inventory and adjust pricing on stagnant and slow-moving products.  Job Requirements & Skills:  · Bachelor’s degree in Data Science (or equivalent data related degree)  · Proficiency in database business reporting  · Strong understanding of relational databases with SQL knowledge preferred.  · Minimum 2 years’ experience in inventory item and category creation  · Expertise in disseminating product data.  · Minimum 2 years’ experience managing pricing strategies  · Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel  · Minimum 2 years as a NetSuite ERP Administrator with confirmed certification of the following:  o NetSuite SuiteFoundation certification (Required)  o NetSuite Administrator certification. (Required)  o NetSuite SuiteAnalytics User certification. (Preferred.  o NetSuite Application Developer certification. (Preferred)  o NetSuite Web Services Developer certification. (Preferred)  · Working knowledge of SharePoint, Power BI and Regex are a plus, but not required.  · Project Management experience and top organizational skills  · Strong verbal and written communication skills.  · Leadership with an affinity for developing personnel into higher positions within the company.  · A desire for promotion to higher levels of leadership, career development & related compensation.  Compensation & Benefits  :  · Salary - $100,000+ Commensurate with experience  · Health Insurance – United Healthcare  · PTO (Paid Time Off) Base + length of service. (Up to 4-Weeks)  · Safe Harbor 401(k) Retirement Plan – Company Matching  · Voluntary MetLife Insurance Policies (Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Home, Auto & much more)  · Performance bonuses (both Monthly & Annually)  · Flex-Time & Comp Time  · Casual dress code  · Company paid Friday lunches. Free coffee bar & purified water.  · Standard Company Hours: 8am to 5pm (Monday – Thurs) and 8am to 4pm (Fridays)  (This is an On-Site Position; not a part time or full time “work from home” option)   Application & Consideration Requirements:  · Personal cover letter or email explaining why you believe you are a great fit for the position and the company.  · Your professional resume  · Three professional references  · Send to information to: Dean Leipsner, EVP of Sales and Marketing   dean@capitolscientific.com  About Capitol Scientific   - Capitol Scientific was founded in 1963 in Austin, Texas and remains a premiere distributor of lab supplies and specialty chemicals to tens thousands of companies and institutions throughout the United States. We represent over 350 manufacturers offering laboratory equipment, consumables and related specialty chemicals used in the industrial, pharma, biotech, semiconductor, aerospace, manufacturing, academic, life sciences, environmental, and governmental labs. To learn more about Capitol Scientific, please visit us at: https://www.capitolscientific.com/about-us  Legal Notice  : Capitol Scientific is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all candidates for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Company Overview:   Science On Call is revolutionizing restaurant tech support through cutting-edge AI and automation tools. As a rapidly growing startup, we've graduated from prestigious accelerator programs like Techstars Farm to Fork and Food Foundry. Our mission is to liberate restaurants from digital operational headaches, enabling them to focus on delivering exceptional dining experiences  Join Us:   If you're passionate about leveraging AI and automation to transform industries, Science On Call offers an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact. Join us in redefining restaurant tech support and beyond.  Role Overview:   As our first in-house engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of Science On Call's product and the product engineering team. Working closely with the Head of Product and CTO, you'll lead the development of our AI-powered platform, taking it from today’s MVP to tomorrow’s enterprise-level solution. Collaborate with leadership to refine and execute our ambitious product roadmap.  Drive the evolution of our product engineering culture and mentor future team members.  Stay at the forefront of technological advancements through continuous learning and professional development. LLM APIs: Experience with large language model APIs and integrating them into applications.  Machine Learning: Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and frameworks. DevOps Knowledge: Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and orchestration.  Data Management: Experience in data preprocessing, cleaning, transformation, and knowledge of SQL/NoSQL databases. Automation: Familiar with creating and managing bots in the Automation Anywhere environment.  Front End: Experience in wireframing, UI/UX processes, and/or creating front-end web pages.  Automations: Experience with “Digital Workers”/robotic process automation (RPA).  Education/Training:  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field, with relevant Azure certifications being a plus.  Preferred:  Experience or understanding of hospitality and the restaurant industry in particular, or hospitality tech. The role is fully remote, though occasional in-person work sessions are expected. Therefore, we strongly prefer candidates located in Chicagoland or the Twin Cities metro area to be in proximity to our respective Chicago/Minneapolis offices. In support of the law practice, Esquire Law provides a unique combination of highly experienced legal expertise with the process, technology, and access to legal and business professionals, providing an approach and expertise beyond a conventional law firm. Must exercise sound judgment, work independently, and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues.
