job_title: Software Engineer For Ai Training Data (Python)
job_info: Accepted Locations  We are accepting applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting some countries in Africa and Asia. For the full list of accepted locations see: https://public.3.basecamp.com/p/AZ8gT73qc5vuYUi6ZT3YccrK . This work is 100% remote.  Loom Video  Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40  Overview  You’ll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the worlds most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the biggest players in the AI/LLM space today. We are seeking software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!  What Will I Be Doing?  Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale  Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code  Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively  We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from "which piece of Python code is better?" to "make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterwards to make it faster"  Pay Rates  US - 50/hr  Brazil - 28.70 USD /hr  Egypt - 22.05 USD /hr  Phillipines - 25.55 USD /hr  All other Non US Countries - 35 USD /hr  Expectations are 15+ hours per week however there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hrs per week and some that are working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid on a weekly basis. You get paid per hour of work done on the platform.  Contract Length  Long term, there is no end date. They expect to have work for the next 2 years.  You can end the contract at any time. Our hope is that you would commit to 12 months of work, but if you start and it's not a fit for you, we totally understand.  Flexible Schedules  Developers can set their own hours - ideal candidates will be interested in spending 40 hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but incredibly flexible on working hours.  Take a 3 hour lunch, no problem. You are paid according to time   spent on the platform  , which is calculated in the coding exercises, as opposed to tracking your own hours.  Interview Process  Apply using this Ashby form: https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/g2i/f1d8e357-958c-4bdc-b6e2-7ddfc3063ba2?utm_source=bmBLO8Y04x  If you look like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and would need to be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.  You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll setup a group call to answer further questions about onboarding with the company.  You'll perform a simulated production level task RLHF task on the platform. This will be your final interview and will ultimately determine your employment and leveling.  Tech Stack Priorities  The current priority for this team is engineers with either a Data Science background that know Python well or software engineers that are well versed with Python.  Required Qualifications:  3+ years of experience in a software engineering/software development role.  Complete fluency in the English language.  Ability to articulate complex scientific concepts clearly and engagingly.  Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing.  Solid understanding of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.  Proficiency with Python  Nice To Have's:  Bachelor's and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science  Proficiency in working with one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, C++. SQL, Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell, C, C#  Recognized accomplishments or contributions to the coding community or in projects.  Proven analytical skills with an ability to approach problems creatively.  Adept communication skills, especially when it comes to understanding and discussing project requirements.  A commitment to continuous learning, and staying updated with the latest in coding advancements and best practices.  Enthusiasm for teaching AI models and experience with technical writing!  Job Type: Contract  Pay: $22.00 - $50.00 per hour  Expected hours: No less than 15 per week  Experience level:  3 years  Schedule:  Choose your own hours  Work Location: Remote

Description:      We are building a B2B product from the ground up using a modern technology stack that makes a real difference for thousands of patients. Our candidate for this role is a subject matter expert well-versed in azure cloud and engineering practices and principles including planning, building, tuning, and maintaining reporting services, technology, and bi workspaces. The Reporting Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Power BI, Azure services, and Python. This role involves working closely with stakeholders to understand their data requirements, transforming raw data into meaningful insights, and ensuring data accuracy and availability.   Hybrid Role – 3 days in office (T-TH)    Power BI Development  :    Design, develop, and deploy interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.    Create data models and establish data connections.    Implement measures, calculated columns, and DAX queries to support complex data analysis.    Azure Data Services:    Utilize Azure Data Factory for ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.    Manage and optimize Azure Data Lake for efficient data storage and retrieval.    Integrate various azure services (such as Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Fabric) to streamline data workflows.    Python Scripting:    Develop Python scripts for data cleaning, transformation, and automation tasks.    Create and maintain Python-based APIs and data processing pipelines.    Implement machine learning models and algorithms for advanced data analysis.    Data Management and Governance:    Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security across all reporting solutions.    Develop and maintain documentation for data models, configurations, and processes.    Monitor data quality and troubleshoot issues related to data discrepancies or system errors.    Stakeholder Collaboration:    Work closely with business users to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.    Provide training and support to end-users on using Power BI reports and dashboards.    Communicate findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.    Continuous Improvement:    Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics.    Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement innovative solutions.    Participate in code reviews and knowledge-sharing sessions within the team.    EEO    Requirements:      Education  :    Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, data science, or a related field.    Experience  :    Proven experience as a Reporting Engineer or similar role.    Hands-on experience with Power BI, including DAX and Power Query.    Strong knowledge of Azure services, including ADF, Azure SQL DB, MS Fabric and Data Lakes.    Proficiency in Python for data analysis, automation, and machine learning.    Skills  :    Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.    Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and database design.    Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment.    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.    Certifications (Preferred):    Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate.    Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate.    Relevant Python certifications or coursework.    Work Environment:    This position may offer a hybrid work model, with the flexibility to work from home and on-site as required.    Occasional travel might be needed for stakeholder meetings or training sessions.    It will be a plus:    Knowledge of HIPAA and SOC2    Azure DevOps and Git experience    .Net experience and EF (Entity Framework)

*Please be aware of impersonators reaching out to collect your personal information through various requests such as job offers. Only emails from the domains @abstraxtech.com or @abstraxhops.com are legitimate.  Company:   We are a family of scientists, farmers, and pioneers working toward the development of a modern, global industry. Our core value of   Innovative Creativity   is why Abstrax Tech, Inc. is a leading   innovator of the sensorial experiences   that shape the cannabis industry.  We specialize in ingredient, processing, and formulation science with a specific focus on terpene research as it relates to:  Flavor Profiles  Fragrance  Discovering New Valuable Molecules  Abstrax collaborates with established equipment and instrument manufacturers to help advance the industry in the manufacturing and analytical sectors.  We are with some of the industry’s largest & growing brands, doing custom formulations for products like vape pens, concentrates, topicals, tinctures, alcohol and more. Although we create   Raving Fans   everywhere we go, we credit our success to our ability to curate a culture of   Teamwork  . We are intentional with our recruiting process, ensuring we build our teams with tremendous   Care   who will continue to deploy the highest   Quality   of products.  What We Can Do For You:  Provide insight into a specialized, high growth industry  Provide the opportunity to acquire highly sought out skills  Provide the opportunity to further enhance current professional strengths  Provide a clear path for career advancement  Provide a safe environment to produce quality work  Extras:   Affordable group medical/dental/vision coverages  Over 3 weeks of paid time off and holidays  Annual performance reviews  Abstrax Tech Perks dashboard  401K  Paid Parental Leave  Analytical Flavor Chemist   As the Analytical Flavor Chemist, you’ll play a crucial role in our dynamic and rapidly growing company. Your primary responsibility will be operating a brand new cutting-edge piece of analytical instrument, the multidimensional gas chromatograph, triple quadrupole mass spectrometer, and olfactometer (MDGC/TQMS/O). As the subject matter expert working with this piece of instrument, you will support numerous exciting flavor and aroma projects in the beer, beverage and cannabis spaces. You’ll not only maintain but also enhance the performance of this instrument through continuous improvement and innovation efforts. Your work will directly impact the quality and flavor of our fruit, cannabis, and hop-based products and beyond!  What You Will Do:  Compound Identification: Expertise in identifying compounds that contribute to flavor profiles.  Quantitation: Accurate and precise measurement of trace volatile molecules.  Method Development: Creating efficient and effective analytical methods.  Sample Preparation: Ensuring accurate and consistent sample handling.  Workflow Optimization: Streamlining processes for maximum efficiency.  Data Visualization: Presenting findings in clear and compelling ways.  Collaboration: Working closely with internal and external partners.  Safety and Compliance: Adhering to laboratory safety protocols.  Innovation: Contributing to product development and innovation.  Sensory Analysis: Evaluating flavors and aromas of cannabis and hop products.  Technical Presentations: Sharing insights with colleagues and stakeholders.  Qualities and Skills You Will Need:  Education: Bachelor’s degree in analytical chemistry or food science.  Experience: Minimum of 5 years working with analytical instrumentation.  Preferred Experience:  Master’s degree in Flavor Chemistry  MDGC/MS/MS analysis  Olfactometry analysis  Sensory analysis of beverages  Literature search  Publication  Attend conferences  5% travel (2-3 weeks per year)  Nice to Haves:   Flavor Expertise: Knowledgeable in the flavor chemistry of beer and beverages.  Instrument Operation: Familiarity with Triple Quad MS/MS operation.  Quantitative Skills: Proficient in quantitating trace volatile compounds.  Problem-solving: Ability to troubleshoot and maintain analytical equipment.  Efficient Workflows: Establishing streamlined laboratory processes.  Experimental Design: Understanding of experimental design principles.  Time Management: Efficiently managing multiple projects.  Safety Awareness: Complying with safety requirements.  Technical Proficiency: Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite, statistical analysis software (e.g., JMP), and essential data science tools (R, Python, PowerBI).  Physical Stamina: Able to sit, smell, and interact with voice recording software for extended periods.  Collaboration: Effective communication with colleagues and external partners.  Precision: Creating accurate analytical standards and managing samples.  Presentation Skills: Delivering technical presentations.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year  Benefits:  401(k)  Dental insurance  Employee discount  Flexible schedule  Health insurance  Life insurance  Paid parental leave  Paid time off  Vision insurance  Schedule:  8 hour shift  Monday to Friday  Weekends as needed  Application Question(s):  Are you comfortable working in a cannabis adjacent organization?  Education:  Bachelor's (Required)  Ability to Commute:  Tustin, CA 92780 (Required)  Work Location: In person

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to unearth new insights that the business can action against to drive value. This role involves partnering with various functions to develop decision models using statistical techniques that will help drive business goals. This position is a hybrid role and can be located in the Battle Creek, MI or Chicago/Naperville, Illinois areas.    On the Kellanova North America (KNA) IT Data and Analytics team, we focus on agility, growth, and innovation. We aim to enhance decision-making capabilities, maximizing growth potential for our trusted food brands.      A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing      Data Modeling   – Our objective is to enhance decision-making capabilities in the commercial and supply chain domains. This involves elevating existing modeling methods, contributing to the development of optimized decision models that account for uncertainty using probabilistic or other techniques. Additionally, you’ll lead high-value, large-scale data science projects and advance our statistical and machine learning tools.    Stakeholder Engagement   - Work with business subject matter experts to see the world through their eyes. Pilot proof of concept models using limited to very large and unstructured data sets is often required. The Senior Data Scientist needs to be comfortable in exposing the rationale in easy-to-understand terms for the business.    Data Analytics –   In this role, you’ll conduct cross-disciplinary research and offer recommendations for big data infrastructure withing the broader IT function. Additionally, you’ll provide thought leadership across the business domain, proposing and simplifying complex paradigms. Not all the data will be readily available; understanding existing internal resources and leveraging new data collection processes, including external sources will be essential.    Training and Mentoring –   This position is responsible for end-user training of the models or tools you develop, along with your coupling your domain and modelling expertise. Provide guidance, training and problem-solving assistance to other team members whilst mentoring less-experienced individuals.    We’re Looking for Someone With        M.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or another related field. Or specialized training/certification or equivalent work experience    Significant experience in applying data science within a consumer centric organization or other relevant experience    Programming experience in either Python/ R or other similar platforms    Experience in data analysis, data manipulation, data mining, algorithm development, or machine learning/artificial intelligence    Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to different audiences across the team, business partners, external stakeholders, etc.    What’s Next    After you apply, your application will be reviewed by a real recruiter, so it may take us a few weeks to get back with you by email or phone. Visit our   How We Hire page   to get insights into our hiring process and more about what we offer.    Need assistance throughout the application or hiring process? Email   USA.Recruitment@Kellanova.com  .    If you join our team, you’ll be rewarded for the difference you make. Our comprehensive benefits offer you the support you need through your life events, big or small. Visit our benefits page & be sure to ask your recruiter for more specific information.    Get to Know Us    At Kellanova, we are driven by our vision to be the world’s best-performing snacks-led powerhouse, unleashing the full potential of our differentiated brands and our passionate people. Our portfolio of iconic, world-class brands include Pringles, Cheez-It, Pop-Tarts, MorningStar Farms, Special K, Krave, Zucaritas, Crunchy Nut, among others.    Kellanova’s Culture of Best means we bring our best to all that we do in pursuit of our vision to be the world’s best performing snacks-led powerhouse. Our culture celebrates boldness and empowers our people to challenge the status quo, achieve results, and win together.    Our focus on Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (ED&I) enables us to build a culture of belonging where all employees have a place at the table and are inspired to share their passion, talents and ideas to work.      The best brands. The best people. The best you.    Estimated travel is 10-15% but may vary depending on location of residency.    Kellanova is an Equal Opportunity Employer that strives to provide an inclusive work environment, a seat for everyone at the table, and embraces the diverse talent of its people. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information regarding our efforts to advance Equity, Diversity & Inclusion, please visit our website   here  .

job_title: Head Of R And D Data Engineering
job_info: Job Title: Head of R & D Data Engineering    Location: Bridgewater, NJ or Cambridge, MA    About the Job    At Sanofi, we’re committed to providing the next-gen healthcare that patients and customers need. It’s about harnessing data insights and leveraging AI responsibly to search deeper and solve sooner than ever before. Join as Head of R&D Data Engineering and you can help make it happen. Your job? Build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack. Work with renowned, published leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.    We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. We're also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started?    Main Responsibilities:    Lead a team of data and software engineers to plan, design, execute and continuously improve Sanofi’s ambitions in R&D data products.    Collaborate with scientific and business and information technology leadership to influence the Data strategy and direction. Present technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.    Strategically plan and execute data engineering initiatives, including the development of data pipelines. Design a comprehensive data engineering roadmap and execute the vision behind it.    Lead technology execution of data engineering required to transform, harmonize data required for AI/analytics and build-out of re-useable aggregated data sets and APIs. Leverage knowledge of data architecture to enhance data pipeline effectiveness.    Play a pivotal role in defining data engineering standards, driving innovation, and ensuring consistency across projects, adopting a Center of Excellence style approach.    Build and manage talent of a team of engineers across multiple geographies to apply to data product teams including establishing a scalable approach to manage scale flexibly across internal resources, technology hubs and external service providers    Address challenges related to data harmonization, normalization, and feature extraction. Adhere to regulatory guidelines (e.g., HIPAA, GxP, GDPR) in handling sensitive data and implement robust data security measures.    About You:    BS in computer science, software engineering or related area with at least 10+ years of experience in working on the development of data pipelines and data products.    Demonstrated ability to lead a team of data engineers in product based operating model in collaboration with digital product owners to plan and execute large scale data projects, with proficiency in data modeling.    Demonstrated knowledge of data consumption patterns, with a focus on Business Intelligence/Machine Learning/similar methods that rely on well-organized data.    Understanding of software development methodology lifecycle practices and documentation including GxP compliance policies and procedures.    Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computing environments (e.g. AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark, Snowflake?).    Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, data visualization and data storytelling skills.    Experience in leading a team focused on the organization, storage, retrieval and initial processing of high throughput large biological and clinical data.    Expertise with core data science languages (such as Python, R, Scala), and proficiency with key database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL).    Why Choose Us    Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.    Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it's through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally .    Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.    Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks' gender-neutral parental leave.    Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.      #GD-SA    #LI-SA

job_title: Solution Developer I - Automation & Innovation Management
job_info: What You Can You Expect?    Find joy in serving others with IEHP! We welcome you to join us in “healing and inspiring the human spirit” and to pivot from a “job” opportunity to an   authentic experience!    The Solution Developer I- Automation & Innovation Management focuses on cutting-edge tech domains, solving complex business issues through AI, ML, and RPA. As part of the COE, you’ll use critical thinking for automated processes, collaborate with stakeholders, and optimize efficiency. This role involves extracting insights, collaborating on process. From reviewing processes to submitting code for version control, this developer ensures high-quality outputs with a tangible impact on efficiency. Excitingly, they work on transforming uses cases into assets and continuously improve processes, contributing to innovation and automation development best practices.    Key Responsibilities    1. Use critical thinking to develop automated processes to solve problems related to business use cases, specifically requiring manual intervention due to heavily repetitive or monotonous tasks, with consideration to high value use cases with considerable ROI.    2. Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.    3. Collaborate with business stakeholders, process analyst, and Team Members to assess current business processes and identify opportunities for process automation.    4. Be knowledgeable about the use of programming tools, coding tools, RPA, AI, ML tools such as Anaconda Navigator, python libraries, and any tool acquired that is maintained or used within IT for automation purposes. Present the reasons for use of the selected tool; justify using the tool to build the proposed automation solution..    5. Collaboratively work to solve complex problem statements for our clients relating to automation and processes across all lines of business, business units, and programs.    6. Review both manual and technical processes within business units to facilitate automated processing, improving efficiencies and quality metrics.    7. Prepare and maintain accurate, detailed process documentation, including technical requirements, error handling, and exception procedures during development.    8. Work with team to create/define Automated processes relative to resolving business automation use cases that will be used to create efficiencies in and continuous improvement of processes including automation, optimization, and elimination of redundant or repetitive tasks.    9. Submit code to Git/DevOps repository for version control and as a source of reusable/open information for other RPA/Automation developers.    10. Develop an understanding of RPA, Low-Code/No-Code solutions and the ability to work with various software tools to create automation solutions that align with defined business and functional requirements.    11. Acquire a solid understanding of the principles of data engineering, including data wrangling/transformation, tools or programming languages, and data visualization/BI technologies for the purposes of automating processes involving data manipulation.    Commitment to Quality: The IEHP Team is committed to incorporate IEHP’s Quality Program goals including, but not limited to, HEDIS, CAHPS, and NCQA Accreditation.    Perks!    IEHP is not only committed to healing and inspiring the human spirit of our Members, but we also aim to match our team members with the same energy by providing prime benefits and more.    Competitive salary.    Hybrid schedule.    CalPERS retirement.    State of the art fitness center on-site.    Medical Insurance with Dental and Vision.    Life, short-term, and long-term disability options    Career advancement opportunities and professional development.    Wellness programs that promote a healthy work-life balance.    Flexible Spending Account – Health Care/Childcare    CalPERS retirement    457(b) option with a contribution match    Paid life insurance for employees    Pet care insurance    Education & Requirements    Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or relevant technical field from an accredited institution required.    In lieu of the required degree, a minimum of four (4) years of additional relevant work experience is required for this position. This experience is in addition to the minimum years listed in the Experience Requirements above.    A minimum of two (2) years of information systems experiences at a developer level, with a successful track record with:    RPA/AI/ML developer, solutions developer, or solutions architect.    Facilitate discussions around potential solutions and help to drive consensus on the best approach to resolve conflicts and overcome obstacles that may arise during the implementation of automation solutions.    Researching, designing, implementing, and managing RPA projects.    Testing and evaluating new programs.    Identifying areas for modification in existing programs and subsequently developing these modifications.    Writing and implementing efficient code; researching, building, and designing self-running artificial intelligence (AI) systems to automate predictive models.    Spectrum of offerings across basic RPA to machine learning, cognitive automation, and Quantum Computing capabilities.    RPA/automation assessment work to drive key automation outcomes.    Key Qualifications    Effective communication skills: oral, written, listening and concept delivery and PoC demonstrations.    Data analytics/automation tools: Alteryx, Microsoft Power Query, Microsoft Power Apps.    Exposure to big data approaches: PySpark, Apache Spark, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, Azure ML, Java. Pager is a virtual care collaboration platform that provides access to whole-person healthcare in a trusted, convenient, connected care experience, like having a “doctor in the family.” Pager helps people make better healthcare decisions by enabling better access and reducing costs, making care simple and easy to understand throughout the entire care journey. Through a combination of hi-tech AI automation and hi-touch concierge services, Pager offers an integrated, full-service experience including triage, telemedicine, e-prescriptions, appointment scheduling, after-care follow-up, care advocacy and customer service. Pager’s omni-channel communications platform connects the fragmented healthcare ecosystem by aggregating a care team of nurses, doctors, pharmacists, coordinators, advocates and more in one place. Pager partners with leading payers, providers and employers representing more than 23 million people across the United States and Latin America.      We're seeking a skilled Data Science Engineer to join our team, where you'll spearhead the development of predictive models. Your mission will be to collaborate closely with healthcare stakeholders, uncovering key business challenges and work with complex healthcare data sets to improve the Pager Health enterprise and member experience. This role will report to the Director of Product – Data & AI and will work cross functionally with stakeholders across the company.        Responsibilities:          Develop predictive models to forecast trends, optimize resource allocation, and improve outcomes, utilizing machine learning and statistical methodologies.      Develop and deploy prototype and/or production models and proposed products based on foundational LLMs.      Design and tune, comprehensively test, automate deployment, and monitor existing models.      Work effectively with all areas of the organization in a global company, from engineering to sales, spanning different countries and regions on proof of concepts and/or technical projects.      Evaluate design of competitive products in the marketplace to seek and identify beneficial enhancements to our own products.      Support the Director, Product-Data and AI in building a compelling roadmap using the latest technical advances in ML and AI.      Identify and design tools and processes required for production and distribution.      Leverage biostatistics and other traditional statistical methods to advance our use of data.      Work with data, AI, and analytics to improve the Pager Health enterprise and member experience.          Requirements:          5+ years related work experience relevant work experience.      Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related discipline.      2 + years of data science or machine learning engineering experience including delivering high quality data science solutions to stakeholders.      Proven experience as a Data Sciencetist within the healthcare industry.      Demonstrated Generative AI competencies.      Demonstrated experience in applying data science techniques to healthcare datasets, including proficiency in Python/R and SQL.      Experience developing and productionizing machine learning models at scale.      Experience with streaming and real time models a plus.      Working knowledge of application development and/or web development and version control preferred.      Working knowledge of 'Big Data' concepts, No SQL dbs, Spark, etc preferred.      Strong ability to independently and proactively initiate projects, hypothesize data & business transaction flows and offer technical solutions.      Strong business analytical skills a must; ability to apply business logic to design and implement data profiling & exploring techniques on large data sets.      Ability to write clear, concise reports and presentations for both peers and management, with an ability to orally communicate effectively; organizational and documentation skills a must.      An understanding of risk management methodology and factors.      Demonstrated ability to work independently and within a team in a fast changing environment with changing priorities and changing time constraints.      Passion for growth and learning new techniques with vigor and enthusiasm. Strong individual contributor with top notch team collaboration skills.      Experience with biostatistics as related to population health, a plus.      Knowledge of a deep learning library (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow), a plus.      Knowledge of statistical analysis, data mining and predictive modeling tools and techniques, a plus.        Offers are contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. This may include but is not limited to substance testing, education, employment, references, state and federal licensure and certifications, criminal history, Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and General Services Administration (GSA) exclusions checks.      For Colorado, Nevada, New York, and Washington DC-based employment: In accordance with the Pay Transparency laws the pay range for this position is $112,000 to $132,000. The compensation package may include stock options, plus a range of medical, dental, vision, financial, generous PTO, stipends for professional development, and wellness benefits. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location. The range listed only applies to Colorado, Nevada, New York, and Washington DC.      At Pager, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Overview:      Join UW Credit Union as a pivotal IT leader and make a significant impact on our business. We are seeking a strategic   IT Infrastructure Engineering Manager   with a passion for leadership and cutting-edge technology.    In this role, you will oversee the architecture, design, and implementation of our IT infrastructure, supporting our voice, data, server, storage, and unified communications. Your leadership will be key in developing technology solutions that meet our business goals while ensuring compliance with security policies and governance best practices. This position offers a fantastic growth opportunity for those eager to make impactful decisions and drive innovation.    Combining people management, lead-level architecture, design, and hands-on engineering, you will guide UW Credit Union’s journey toward cloud-smart infrastructure, including externally hosted platforms, software, and services. Your strong leadership skills will help develop your team and shape our technology landscape. If you are passionate about leading a high-performing team and making a significant impact, we invite you to join us in this exciting leadership opportunity.    Why Work for UW Credit Union?    Join one of Wisconsin’s premier financial institutions, a 2023 Top Workplaces USA and multi-year recipient of Madison Magazine’s Best Places to Work, Wisconsin State Journal’s Top Workplaces, and Milwaukee Journal Sentinel’s Top Workplaces to receive:    21.5+ days of annual paid time off    2 weeks paid caregiver leave    2.5 weeks paid new child parental leave    2 days paid volunteer time    11 paid holidays (includes your birthday!)    401k company match of up to 5%, plus approximately 4% discretionary match    Generous variable reward bonus    Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans, including domestic partner eligibility    Discounted Bublr membership    Free bus pass    Employee Assistance Program    Hybrid work environment    Salary: $135,000 - $160,000; mid-point is $153,300    And more!    Responsibilities:      What You’ll Do    Develop and advance a top-tier Network Engineers and System Engineers workforce by forecasting future skill needs, ensuring the team is prepared for upcoming challenges and opportunities.    Build and maintain strong relationships with UW Credit Union leaders, acting as a trusted advisor to align IT services with business needs, enabling cost-effective, innovative solutions that adapt to changing priorities.    Understand business drivers and capabilities to design enterprise systems that achieve targeted business outcomes.    Stay current with emerging technology trends and disruptions to enable new and evolving business models.    Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints, documenting all solution design and analysis work.    Analyze industry trends and competitors to assess their impact on the enterprise.    Act as a consultant on diverse technologies and platforms, driving targeted business outcomes.    Lead the evaluation, design, and implementation of solutions for specific business applications or technologies, aligning with enterprise strategy and standards.    Ensure outstanding service for end users by developing metrics and data analytics to illustrate service and operational effectiveness for internal and external customers.    Maintain market-leading monitoring tools to alert team resources of outages or degraded service levels, ensuring timely response and resolution.    Manage team response during critical outages, coordinating technical bridges, vendor escalations, and regular communication with IT End User Services leadership to keep stakeholders informed.    Oversee the IT ticketing system to ensure prompt, accurate ticket assignments and adherence to SLA and quality standards, and coordinate resources for operational commitments and non-business hour activities.    Play a key role in organizational change management, developing and delivering OCM solutions, and partnering with IT End User Services to create knowledge base articles and FAQs for IT and end users.    Create and assist in developing technology-related business proposals for senior leaders, detailing costs, benefits, risks, and desired outcomes.    Ensure data and software backups meet Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO), and assist in preparing and monitoring the annual IT Infrastructure Engineering capital and expense budgets.    Manage vendor relationships, including evaluations, contract negotiations, and ensuring optimal use of vendor resources such as technical support, education, and compliance.    Responsible for essential leadership duties, including but not limited to, inclusive excellence, responsibility and accountability, effective communication, teamwork, high-performance mindset, business acumen, recruitment and retention, change leadership and coaching and development.    Qualifications:      What You’ll Need to Succeed    Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, data science, business, or related field.; relevant work experience will be considered in lieu of educational requirements.    Ability to work on-site 3 days a week and handle escalated on-call situations.    6+ years of experience in technology design, implementation, and support skills along with proven process design/development capabilities    5+ years of formal leadership experience leading System Engineers and/or Network Engineers    Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows PC and Server OS, Active Directory, DHCP, and other core/similar infrastructure technologies.    Working knowledge of data and voice networking, both on-prem and cloud.    Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows PC and Server OS, Active Directory, DHCP, and other core/similar infrastructure technologies.    Budget creation, forecasting and adherence experience.    Demonstrated professional maturity in handling data access, security, sensitivity, and appropriate usage, with familiarity in sophisticated network infrastructures and security.    Effective communication skills, including superior verbal, written, and presentation abilities to effectively guide and inspire.    Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration, teamwork, and the ability to train, coach, and mentor direct reports.    Excellent organizational, time management, analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills to manage and follow through on complex projects.    Self-driven, curious, and creative, with the ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and embrace a diverse, collaborative team environment.    ITIL v3/v4 Foundation certified preferred.    UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.

job_title: Quantitative Analytics Senior (Hybrid- 3 Days In Office)
job_info: At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.    Position Overview:    Are you looking for an opportunity to put your technical skills to use working on advanced modeling challenges? Freddie Mac’s Modeling, Econometrics, Data Science & Analytics Department is currently seeking a Quantitative Analytics Senior who will be responsible for the development and execution of quantitative analytics and modeling projects in support of Freddie Mac’ business. Apply now and learn why there’s #MoreAtFreddieMac!    Our Impact:    Our team is responsible for developing underwriting and credit scoring models.    Your Impact:    Developing analytical methods and models that assess the credit risk of new and existing financial and mortgage products. Conducting research on enhancements to the existing models, and applying industry standard processes and techniques to meet various business needs.    Providing innovative, detailed and practical solutions to an extensive range of demanding and complicated problems.    Implementing statistical models in efficient software languages, coding model prototypes for specification and test cases, modifying source codes in the existing application.    Coordinating the testing through the model implementation, conducting back tests to monitor the model performance, and performing economic tests and stress tests to validate the model forecast results.    Providing modeling and analytical support to a line of business or product area, functioning as day-to-day technical specialist.    Preparing documentation for the technical analytics and rationale through the model development to comply with model oversight and support model review for approval.    Working under limited direction, independently resolving and developing approach to solutions.    Qualifications:    Doctorate degree, or Master degree with 3 years of equivalent work experience, in quantitative finance, statistics, economics or a related quantitative field    Coursework or work experience applying predictive modeling techniques from finance, statistics, mathematics, data science, or computer programming to large data sets. Qualifying coursework may include—but is not limited to—statistics, mathematical programming, optimization, machine learning, computational methods, design and analysis of algorithms, Bayesian methods, derivatives, or Monte Carlo methods    Coursework or work experience writing statistical or optimization programs to develop models and algorithms. Programming languages may include—but are not limited to—SAS, Python, R, SQL, Java, or MATLAB    Keys to Success in this Role:    Effective interpersonal skills including the ability to collaborate successfully with other team members.    Strong oral and written communication skills with ability to succinctly describe complex technical scenarios in simple, easily-understood terms.    Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.    Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC. Information on these benefit programs is available on our Careers site.    This position has an annualized market-based salary range of $118,000 - $178,000 and is eligible to participate in the annual incentive program. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is dependent on various factors including but not limited to the responsibilities of the position, experience, skill set, internal pay equity and other relevant qualifications of the applicant.

Who We Are    Insurity’s vision is all about empowerment. Empowering insurance organizations to quickly capitalize on new opportunities by delivering the world’s most configurable, cloud-native, easy-to-use, and intuitively analytical software. It’s also about empowering our team members through tools, training, teamwork, and professional development opportunities.    To talk the talk, we must walk the walk. We are trusted by 22 of the top 25 Property & Casualty insurance carriers and 7 of the top 10 MGAs in the U.S. today with over 400 cloud-based deployments – and more on the way. That’s proof we walk the walk. While our product suites are some of the most compelling in the industry, it’s our team members who deliver the exceptional value and unrivaled industry expertise our customers appreciate from us.    Our team tells us over and over; working at Insurity offers you the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from some of the most creative and knowledgeable minds in insurance technology. You’ll feel welcomed even before you start your first day with us through our award-winning onboarding program.    Take the first step to joining our team by applying today and we look forward to seeing   #UatInsurity  .    Insurity’s Next Research Scientist    You will be responsible for applying innovative techniques to create new indemnity applications that are more accurate and efficient, and consistently seeking and initiating research topics/hypotheses to solve difficult computing tasks and creating new software products utilizing complex algorithms and data science techniques.    What Our Research Scientists Will Do    Consulting with stakeholders to determine needs/weaknesses    Designing experiments to test the operation of systems    Analyzing experiment results    Formulating mathematical models to improve underwriting results    Presenting findings/recommendations to management    Specifying business requirements for I.T. projects to be deployed    Monitoring performance of implemented solutions, and applying enhancements as needed    Coordinating multidisciplinary project activities with product development teams and actuarial staff as needed    Who We’re Looking For    U.S. Master's degree in any quantitative discipline    2 years' experience: updating and enhancing existing indemnity-related decision support programs; analyzing needs; transforming requirements into technical specifications; providing proof of concept for software solutions; implementing indemnification solutions; and troubleshooting/performing fixes    What’s In It For U    Flex First Workforce  : Do your work best from home or from one of our office locations; it’s your choice.    Generous Time Off  : Our leadership believes in taking the time you need when you need it through our Open PTO Policy.    Day One Health Benefits + Employer-Matched Retirement Savings  : You might think these are table stakes, but we know these matter to you.    More Than Just Core Values  : Our values are fundamental in how we attract, train, and retain top talent.    Award-Winning Onboarding Program  : We set you up from the get-go to make a significant impact from Day One and follow you through your entire first year.    Real Career Growth Opportunities  : We love to promote from within with over 20% of our open roles filled through internal applicants last year.    Mentorship Program:   We support a champion culture and growth mindset by pairing you with experienced, talented leaders to help you grow personally and professionally.    Internal Networking:   Build relationships, network, collaborate, and stay connected with colleagues internally with our one-of-a kind online   Coffee for Two   program.    Continuous Learning Opportunities  : Own your development with your own LinkedIn Learning + Ted@Work + Kaplan licenses.    Discounted University Tuition  : Employees and their families can start or continue their university career with less out-of-pocket investment through our partnerships with the University of Arizona Global Campus.    Employee Referral Bonus  : Once you come onboard, give Insurity the biggest compliment you can give by referring someone to work here and earn a cash bonus.    We have five Core Values at Insurity; one of which is to   Act with Integrity  . Providing pay transparency helps you make the best decision for you. We continuously analyze and update our salaries for our roles according to market trends to not only ensure our employees are paid fairly, but also help close gender, race, and disability wage gaps. Along with the benefits listed above, the salary for this role is $93,800.    Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer    We are dedicated to creating an exceptional work environment for all our employees by extending a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging into the very fabric of our organization. We embrace differences and diversity of identity, experience, and thought, and actively strive for inclusive behaviors across our company.    We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application and/or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.    Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Software Developer  Join the RF Code Team  Software Developers at RF Code get to do what other software developers don’t! They get to work alongside an amazing hardware engineering team to turn data collected by wireless sensors into amazing data driven software solutions for our current and future customers to use to run world class data centers.  Our customer list includes some of the most recognizable brands on the planet with global deployments at IBM, Dell, Bloomberg, and CenturyLink and so many more.  Software Developers at RF Code also enjoy a hybrid position with the flexibility to work remotely some days.  Job Summary:  RF Code is looking for a Software Developer who can develop solutions that turn big time series datasets into actionable information that customers can use to see where they are doing well, where there is room for improvement and what they can do about it.  Bring us your skills and experience in developing solutions for applied analytics, prediction, anomaly detection, recommendations or other ways you have created high value solutions from data.  You will also have the opportunity to work on other feature and non-feature development tasks for our on-premises and cloud-based products.  This is a hybrid position requiring at least 2.5 days a week in the Austin, Texas headquarters.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. RF Code will not sponsor applicants for work visas.  Requirements  4+ years of work experience as a Software Developer developing software for large businesses  Skills and experience developing solutions that turn data into actionable information such as: Applied analytics, Prediction, Classification, and Recommendations  Skills and experience developing solutions with: Java, JavaScript, and/or SQL  Ability to collaborate and work as part of a team to achieve objectives  Ability to collaborate on and document solution design and implementation  Ability to write unit and integration tests  Ability to communicate clearly in both verbal and written communications  Knowledge of Web development and RESTful APIs  Desirable  While not required, candidates with any or all of the following will excel in the Software Developer job at RF Code:  Skills and experience developing solutions with Python  Experience with open-source and enterprise software stacks such as: Spring and/or Hibernate  Experience with large datasets and time series data  Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as ReactJS or Ext JS  Familiarity with Event Driven architecture  User-interface development  Experience with relational databases such as MS SQL and/or PostgreSQL  Experience developing solutions for data centers  Experience developing solutions with machine learning or artificial intelligence  Education/Experience  College degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related ﬁeld  Benefits  Working at RF Code you have great benefits available to you, such as:  Competitive pay  Company sponsored insurance: Medical (PPO or HDHP), Dental, and Vision; Company pays generous percentage of insurance premiums  Available: 401(k) with company match, Medical Flexible Spending Account (FSA) with Medical PPO, Health Savings Account (HSA) with HDHP including employer contribution and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account  Company paid Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability Insurance, and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Voluntary additional Life Insurance available  Generous Paid Time Off : Vacation, sick and personal time  About RF Code  RF Code is a pioneer in software solutions enabled by wireless sensors and IoT technology. Our solutions are used by Data Center Operators, IT Infrastructure and Asset Management Teams, Managed Service Providers and more in some the world’s largest data centers.  We are an American company with our headquarters in Austin Texas, where we even manufacture and assemble some of our products.  RF Code is an equal opportunity employer offering excellent benefits (medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible work hours, paid time off, stocked kitchen and more) and a great work environment. If you are ready to grow, please apply. Are you seeking a career that's not only exciting but also deeply meaningful? At Tosca, we offer a unique opportunity to transform the supply chain with sustainable solutions that safeguard perishable goods and benefit our planet. Our mission is to eliminate single-use packaging, a crucial step towards a more sustainable future, by converting it to reusable containers.  Are you ready to play a critical role as the Asset Management Director at Tosca? Your expertise in leveraging data analytics to enforce organizational policies and processes will ensure the control and protection of Tosca's physical assets. By developing innovative, data-driven methodologies for tracking and tracing assets throughout our Supply Chain, you will drive optimal asset utilization and minimize losses. This position reports directly to the Vice President of Supply Chain NA.  Work Schedule  This is a hybrid role. Monday and Friday are work-from-home days, and Tuesday through Thursday are in-office days at our Colony Square office in Midtown.  Job Responsibilities:  Utilize advanced data analytics solutions to track and trace Tosca's assets throughout the Supply Chain, providing real-time visibility and actionable insights.  Conduct in-depth analysis of asset data, including loss, customer turnover, and RPC tracking information, to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.  Utilize predictive analytics and machine learning techniques to anticipate potential asset loss or slow turns, proactively implementing corrective measures.  Collaborate with Customers to ensure accurate and timely reporting of assets, leveraging data to identify opportunities for process optimization and enhanced asset control.  Partner with the Field Audit team to investigate potential loss or misuse areas, using data-driven insights to drive targeted solutions.  Foster a data-driven culture of continuous improvement, leveraging analytics to identify opportunities for process optimization, cost reduction, and asset management excellence.  Partner with cross-functional teams, including IT, Operations, and Customer Service, to integrate asset management data and insights into broader business strategies and initiatives.  Mentor, coach, and train the customer reporting team, guiding best practices, data analysis techniques, and customer communication strategies.  Manage the performance of the customer reporting team, setting clear goals and expectations, providing regular feedback, and identifying opportunities for professional development and growth.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.  Proven track record of success in leveraging data analytics to drive supply chain optimization and asset management initiatives.  Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to mentor and guide a high-performing team of data analysts and asset management professionals.  Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences. Who is Gohagan & Company?  For over 35 years, Gohagan & Company has been creating innovative, small-group, affinity travel programs for intellectually curious and discerning travelers. Our trips are focused on education and culture, carefully curated to delight the mind and ensure that the experience is a comprehensive one. We offer luxury land and cruise itineraries developed by a team of experts who bring decades of experience in planning travel programs around the globe. With deep relationships worldwide and a hard-working, travel-loving team, we continuously reimagine and deliver top quality experiences that our travelers will remember for a lifetime.  Job Summary  Gohagan & Company is growing, and we are looking for individuals passionate about world travel, history, and learning about cultures all over the world. We are looking for a Circulation / Direct Mail Analyst to join our team. A Circulation/Direct Mail Analyst is responsible for running direct mail list selects, analyzing data and developing strategies to optimize the reach and effectiveness of direct mail campaigns. They play a crucial role in ensuring that target audiences are reached efficiently and cost-effectively through physical mailings and produce a positive ROI.  Essential Job Functions:  Campaign Development:  Work with marketing team to develop targeted mailing lists based on demographics, interests, and purchase history.  Select appropriate mail quantities and list per mail piece and offer based on audience segmentation and campaign goals.  Campaign Management:  Monitor campaign performance and assess their effectiveness and efficiency.  Conduct A/B testing to identify the most effective campaign elements.  Analyze results and recommend improvements for future campaigns.  Data Analysis:  Collect and analyze data on campaign performance, including response rates, cost per acquisition, and subscriber demographics.  Identify trends and patterns in data to understand what drives successful campaigns.  Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders.  Stay Informed:  Keep up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in direct mail circulation and direct mail marketing, segmentation and data overlay.  Research new technologies and tools that can improve campaign performance.  What you bring:  · Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Finance or Data Science required.  · Two to three years’ experience in Direct Mail marketing.  · Working knowledge of SQL Server, Alteryx, or any Campaign Management software a plus.  · Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  · Excellent data analysis and reporting skills.  · Experience with marketing databases and CRM systems.  · Knowledge of direct mail best practices and postage regulations.  · Excellent communication and presentation skills.  · Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  · Experience with marketing automation tools.  · Experience with campaign management software.  · Knowledge of direct mail measurement and principles (Response Rates, Acquisition Cost per Customer and Lifetime Value).  · Strong understanding of target audiences, demographic and overlay data attributes.  What you can expect:  · Work with talented and diverse individuals who are passionate about world travel, geography, history, and culture.  · Join a purpose-driven company committed to creating lifelong bucket-list tour experiences for our travelers.  · Work-life balance is important to us, and we want our associates to have balanced lives, so we offer remote working and/or hybrid work arrangements for positions that can be effectively performed remotely.  Personal Characteristics:  · A self-starter, confident in your abilities, self-motivated and able to work effectively with little supervision.  · A high-energy, results-oriented individual who can make a difference; an individual who takes the initiative, makes things happen, accepts accountability, and has a "can do" attitude; has a sense of urgency.  · Solid business acumen with qualitative and quantitative analytical skills.  · Creative and flexible in attitude and style to adapt to new situations in a rapidly changing, dynamic environment.  · Desire to work for a growing company.  · A strong value system, unquestioned integrity, and good listening skills.  · Ability to thrive in a team environment.  Benefits:  Our Company works hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourages everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of benefits to our associates:  · Retirement Plan  · Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage  · Disability Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, and Accident Insurance  · Life Insurance  · Paid Time Off and Sick Leave  · Career growth and development  · Family and Friends discount—have those close to you experience the unique and exciting bucket-list tours.  Compensation:  The salary for our roles depends on circumstances, including an applicant's skills and qualifications, certain degrees and certifications, prior job experience, market data, and other relevant factors. Additional compensation may include a bonus, incentives, or commission.  Being you at Gohagan & Company:  Gohagan & Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The Company’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, including protected veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Gohagan also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also Gohagan’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws respecting consideration of unemployment status in making hiring decisions.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year  Benefits:  401(k)  401(k) matching  Dental insurance  Health insurance  Paid time off  Vision insurance  Schedule:  8 hour shift  Day shift  Monday to Friday  Experience:  Direct Mail marketing: 2 years (Required)  Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chicago, IL 60631

At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.        We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.      At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers - it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.        Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!        To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely        Introduction        Drives product results for broad product area. Able to define roadmap and direction for their area independently.      Leads cross-functional initiatives and identifies opportunities to improve collaboration between teams  Identifies and tracks the right metrics, with their team consistently meeting or exceeding goals  Uses rapid experimentation to learn quickly, iterate & get it right        Job Responsibilities        Influence Strategy & Roadmap      Can rely on breadth of product experience and analogs to aid in decision making in ambiguous situations. Proactively participates in setting strategic direction.      Actively promotes an experimentation mindset by driving hypothesis driven thinking and rapid experimentation in others; active participant in experiment review.  Analyzes complex, evolving circumstances and takes proactive action to appropriately distribute resources and meet goals on deadline      Deliver Products and Drive Usage      Holds self and teams they work with accountable to undeniable impact on department performance      Translates broad company strategies into specific priorities and objectives for their team via clear product roadmap that delivers value to users and buyers  Creates effective plans with a defined purpose and business outcomes, defined roles / responsibilities, and clear timelines / milestones  Sets ambitious goals, doesn't settle for status quo and pushes boundaries appropriately      Collaborate and Communicate      Consistently trusted to prepare and deliver coherent, highly credible, impactful and engaging written communication & presentations      Effectively negotiates ambiguous situations and drives to rapid decisions, for example, cross-functional product dependencies  Shows thought leadership and builds an external presence; starting to communicate externally as a Product expert, either in publications or at events  Can be counted on to help support analyst reports and evals for their areas of the product including demos and filling out questionnaires      Be a Resilient Leader       A visible champion for company & department strategy that inspires confidence      Actively participates and leads changes that enhance Product & ADEPT effectiveness  Provides mentorship to other team members, and may also mentor teammates outside ADEPT  Consistently includes diverse points of view when solving business needs  Actively seeks to present at ADEPT all-hands, S&T as well as other large, cross functional meetings.  Actively seeks and provides hard feedback  Works on products and features of a ambiguous scope; can be trusted to deliver entirely new product lines or explore long-term strategies with little oversight        Knowledge and Experience        Typically 5-8 years product experience; or 3-5 years product experience with extensive experience with Optimizely (internal transfer or as a customer)      PM Expertise: Excels at product management, coaches others, and continues to refine the practice or product management at Optimizely.  Market Awareness: Has perspective on where trends will go (not just what current ones are). Can speak to direction competitors headed (not just current position).  Business Expertise: Expert business knowledge. Developing perspective on product success within the business.  X-Funtional: Work is frequently beyond scope of core areas. Relied on by teams across Opti to represent the product and lead initiatives.  Metrics/Data: Leverages usage data/metrics, business metrics, and market data to inform significant product decisions and longterm.roadmap.        Education        Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience. Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?    Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.    With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.    Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.    The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.    Summary    The Data Platform Business Ownership Vice President is responsible overseeing the team responsible for defining and driving the data strategy, data sourcing, transformation initiatives, and governance of MUFG’s key data platforms owned by the Chief Data Office (CDO). The Data Platform Business Owner VP independently collaborates with executive stakeholders across the business units, IT, and external partners to define the data platform vision, roadmap, and priorities and to ensure the delivery of high-quality data solutions that enable data-driven decision making and innovation.    Responsibilities    Establish and execute the data platform vision and strategy, focused on sourcing additional superset data into the data platform    Enhance the data platforms by driving complex initiatives to bring in AWS tools/services that enable business self-service    Establish and maintain data platform standards, policies, procedures, and best practices to ensure data quality, security, privacy, and compliance    Steer the design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of the data platform, including data ingestion, data processing, data storage, data modeling, data access, data visualization, and data services    Ensure the data platform is scalable, reliable, secure, and cost-effective and meets the current and future data needs of the organization    Drive the adoption and utilization of the data platform across the organization and foster a data-driven culture    Define business self-service governance patterns for accessing data through reporting platforms    Monitor and measure the performance, availability, and usage of the data platform and provide regular reports and feedback to senior management and stakeholders    Identify and evaluate new technologies, tools, and trends in the data domain and recommend solutions that enhance the data platform capabilities and value    Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including business units, IT, vendors, and partners to ensure alignment and collaboration on data platform initiatives    Qualifications    Minimum 8 years of experience in data management, data engineering, data science, or data analytics    Prior consulting experience helpful    Prior people management or team lead experience    Experience in delivering or supporting data platform solutions utilizing cloud-based technologies such as AWS, Tableau, Redshift, LakeFormation, and Collibra    Experience with SQL, Glue PySpark, or other programming languages and frameworks for data analysis and manipulation    Experience in AWS native tools such as Glue, Athena, DMS and Lake Formation for data ingestion, processing, transformation, and analysis    Experience in using data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or Business Objects    Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and ability to communicate complex data concepts and insights to technical and non-technical audiences    Strong strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills and ability to translate business requirements into data solutions    Strong collaboration skills and ability to lead and motivate cross-functional teams    Strong project management, organizational, and time management skills and ability to manage multiple data projects simultaneously    Strong business acumen and understanding of the organization's goals, objectives, and processes    The typical base pay range for this role is between $130K - $155K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays.
